bug.author: Ivyw1219
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Error: Streamlit requires raw Python (.py) files, not . I checked the file format, it is python, not others. The streamlit version is 0.56.0 The python version is 3.7 How can I solve this? <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Go to '...' Click on '....' Scroll down to '....'
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Explain what you expect to happen when you go through the steps above, assuming there were no bugs. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Explain the buggy behavior you experience when you go through the steps above. If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
That is, did this use to work the way you expected in the past? yes / no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: (get it with $ streamlit version) Python version: (get it with $ python --version) Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? OS version: Browser version:
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
If needed, add any other context about the problem here. For example, did this bug come from <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io>https://discuss.streamlit.io</denchmark-link> or another site? Link the original source here!

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Ivyw1219>@Ivyw1219</denchmark-link> , Could you please copy/paste the text in your terminal where you're executing the streamlit command so we can verify the file you're running it against?
Hi @lvyw1219, did you use streamlit run app ? The correct start should be streamlit run app.py

Hey, Jonathan and Matthias, Thanks for your reply.
It’s a bit weird. Sometimes it works, sometimes it does not. But I don’t think that is Streamlit’s problem, maybe it is just my config issue. <denchmark-link:#>…</denchmark-link>
On 3. Apr 2020, at 09:25, Matthias Frank ***@***.***> wrote:
Hi @lvyw1219,
did you use streamlit run app ? The correct start should be streamlit run app.py
— You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#1292 (comment)>, or unsubscribe <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AGZAQNW225RROF765AHQKPLRKWFNFANCNFSM4L2JMB2A>.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Ivyw1219>@Ivyw1219</denchmark-link> , If you provide the following info we can help you debug and will re-open the issue.
Which config are you referring to? Copy/paste the text in your terminal where you're executing the streamlit command
Also can you upgrade to the latest streamlit version, 0.57.3?
Also as MattMacs mentioned, when I try to run streamlit run file instead of streamlit run file.py I get the error you shared
